column4: whenever I install ubuntu, after reboot when it is installing the packages, it gives me some weird error
and I can never get ubuntu to install correctly
text*
and I used the installer
to check it
what speed did you burn it?
x'pseverything is garbage
error that looks like us.archive.ubuntu.com?
no, the error is like the installer crashes, and I see a grey screen with alot of texe
did you burn the cd after downloading it?
yes... but im sure its a valid cd, i did a md5 check on the ISO and on the cd
reburn it at the lowest possible speed
im booting ubuntu live so I can reburn it at 1x
i have burned tham as high as 8 but they say burn at slowest
but still, since it said the media was valid, dosent that mean that there isent any problems with it?
there can be issues when burning too fast i dont make the rules i just know them :(

the iso might be good but if the burn got interuppted by something like your disk drive or left a file in download and never burned it it will cause that problem burning it at slower speed is how its fixed unless its a hardware issue
k3b checked the md5hash of the actual CD after it burned it. Also, ubuntu's installer has a check cd function which said it was valid
k3b checks the md5 before the copy not after it just verifies the copy was made
look man im not gonna argue with you if you dont want to reburn it dont ok but me and nalioth  have told you to see if it fixes it
so do most other distros and not one have i found to be very accurate
